required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cumulative Live Birth Rates in Patients With Repeated Implantation Failure (RIF) Undergoing Preimplantation Genetic Screening (PGS )
clinical_study.official_title: Cumulative Live Birth Rates in Patients With Repeated Implantation Failure (RIF) Undergoing Preimplantation Genetic Screening (PGS )

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a single centre retrospective study in repeated implantation failure patients: < 39 years old, at least 4 D3 good quality embryos or 2 good quality blastocysts transferred without implantation, absence of known causes of implantation failures (uterine malformation, thrombophilia, severe male factor, uncontrolled thyroid disfunction, autoimmune disease).
Patients scheduled for PGS underwent one or more stimulation cycles (oocyte or blastocyst banking) in order to maximize chances of embryo transfer. PGS cycles are analyzed globally. Aditionally, PGS cycles with a single stimulation cycle are analyzed in comparison to standard IVF cycles.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at 24 months of first embryo transfer

arm_group.description: Patients with RIF scheduled for PGS (Preimplantation Genetic Screening) with trophectoderm biopsy using arrays comparative genomic hybridation (aCGH) underwent one or more stimulation cycles. If euploid blastocysts were available, patients underwent frozen embryo transfer/s.

Patients with RIF scheduled for standard IVF (In Vitro Fertilization) underwent a single stimulation cycle with the fresh embryo transfer and the subsequent frozen embryo transfers if there were surplus frozen embryos and the fresh embryo transfer was unsuccessful.

intervention.intervention_name: PGS (Preimplantation Genetic Screening) with trophectoderm biopsy
intervention.description: PGS (Preimplantation Genetic Screening) with trophectoderm biopsy using arrays comparative genomic hybridizatioon (aCGH)

study_pop.textblock: Repeated implantation failure patients: patients <39 years old that have received at least 4 day 3 good quality embryos or 2 good quality blastocists with no implantation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- women < 39 years
- repeated implantation failure: at least 4 day 3 good quality embryos or 2 good quality blastocysts transferred without implantation
Exclusion criteria:
- partner with severe male factor, or abnormal sperm Fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) analysis
- presence of uni or bilateral hydrosalpinx, uterine malformation, thrombophilia, uncontrolled thyroid disfunction or autoimmune disease

facility.name: Departamento de Ginecología Obstetricia y Reproducción. Hospital Universitari Dexeus
